org.netbeans.modules.parsing.spi.indexing.support

Class IndexDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.modules.parsing.spi.indexing.support.IndexDocument

  • public final class IndexDocument
extends Object
    An IndexDocument lets you store a series of [key,value] pairs in the persistent store.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPair(String key, String value, boolean searchable, boolean stored)
      Add a [key,value] pair to this document.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • addPair

        public void addPair(String key,
                    String value,
                    boolean searchable,
                    boolean stored)
        Add a [key,value] pair to this document. Note that the document really contains a multi-map, so it is okay and normal to call addPair multiple times with the same key. This just adds the value to the set of values associated with the key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key that you will later search by. Note that you are NOT allowed to use the keys filename or timestamp since these are reserved (and in fact used) by GSF.
        value - The value that will be retrieved for this key
        searchable - A boolean which if set to true will store the pair with an indexed/searchable field key, otherwise with an unindexed field (that cannot be searched). You must be consistent in how keys are identified as searchable; the same key must always be referenced with the same value for searchable when pairs are added (per document).
